medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal pain and nausea/vomiting for 2 days.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient reports RLQ pain that began last night and has been present for 2 days. The pain was worse this morning but improved after taking Tylenol. Described as sharp and crampy, constant, and worsens with movement. Nausea and vomiting began this morning, with the emesis characterized as mostly spit and some bile. Patient has not attempted solid food since yesterday.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Endometriosis with implants, developed SBO from endometriotic implant leading to resection of 13 cm of sigmoid colon; rectal stricture post-surgery. Past medical history includes hypothyroidism. Past surgeries include bilateral lower extremity fasciotomies and other procedures related to ENT.
